column1:
Javert24601,"2012-11-03T19:19:34.88Z","This is no ordinary minifigure, THIS IS AN URUK HAI!","After chasing down 8 copies of this set I decided I'd get down to business and review one, if not all of them (This review won't have pictures like the last time as I don't have a camera to take them on :/ )

Anyway onto the review.

The Packaging

Just like all other promotional sets, the packaging is just a printed polybag.
column2: I love how Helms Deep can be seen in the background, because Helms deep is the soul purpose for building an army of these! To attack the fortress! &nbsp
column3: The Set Number is printed under the 6-12, outlining the age this pack is meant for? (What's that? Did you just say I'm too old for LEGO?) Anyway your normal packaging front applies (the top with The Lord of the Rings and Sauron's finger along with the lego logo.
column4: On the back there is nothing special apart from the usual warning don't give to 3 yr olds, this pack is recycleable (nothing that says DON'T STICK THIS PACKET TO THE WALL FOR DISPLAY...)
column5:
The Instructions

Again, just like in all other polybag/promo sets, the instructions are tiny but are very clear and get straight to the point. (no idea why you build the Uruk last though) Also on the backside of the instructions is a very nice promo for the Helms Deep set (as I have 8 of these leaflets, one WILL be going on the wall)
column6:
There are 6 steps of building which are very easy.

The Build/Parts

This set features a couple of common and a couple of lesser common pieces, and of course a piece that is exclusive to the Lord of the Rings Liscensed Theme (The Uruk Hai Helmet).
column7: Not bad for 21 pieces, plus you get a very nice Halberd, which brings me memories of the Knight's Kingdom sets from way back with King Leo's Castle and Bull's attack and things like that. The build is very straightforward that anyone could do it with their eyes closed (well, I can anyway, just by feeling the bits.)
column8:
The Minifigure

This figure is lovely! It really looks like an Uruk from the Two Towers film and I love the way lego had represented it! The helmet is lovely, and the head has two sides, so you can decide which face to put under the helmet, looking on into the battle.
column9: One has a sort of very fierce expression, the other has a snarling type of expression. &nbsp
column10: The printing of the torso is very nice, but is covered up by the chest armour, it also features back printing. The legs also feature printing. &nbsp
column11:
This is the feature of the set, as everyone wants it for the Uruk (to be fair, I like the ballista, but it's not very sophisticated, but then again why would it be when it's only a promo set. oh and the flick fire on the ballista works well.

Overall

The set is very nice, the perfect army builder and good if you like flickfire missles... now if you decided to get as many as I did (10) then to me that's a great start, but 10,000? That's far too many!

Ratings

KFOL - 6/10, it's a LOTR set, not many KFOLs will have seen it

TFOL - 10/10, a gem of a little set for collectors like me

AFOL - 10/10, again a gem of a little set for others too, and of course the perfect set to army build if you can!

I really hope this review wasn't boring without the pictures, I promise that I shall review Frodo's Cooking Corner (hopefully) with pictures, as that is how I like to review these things, I hope this review was helpful to you!

Thanks again for reading!",TRUE,3,4,3,4,5

column1:
arl100,"2012-11-07T13:56:53.913Z","Saruman had to start somewhere","

Didn't fancy queuing behind loads of people at my local WHS, so managed to pick these up cheaply on eBay (if you look, they are out there well priced). The set itself is OK, a little ballista with LEGO's famous 'flick-fire missile', but the Uruk-Hai was the sole reason I bought this. Arguably the cheapest army builder, this is my first set for the Lord of the Rings (after deciding Star Wars was getting too samey and too expensive).

• Cheap ones will soon disappear
  • Better with the Uruk sword &

Overall, a good promo, but find it cheaply or just buy the Uruk separate if that is all you are after. A good find for not a lot of money, and a quick and easy way to build an army.

,TRUE,4,4,4,4,5 Odeinoichus","2012-12-22T20:27:50.083Z","Build me an Army!","

Set #30211 Uruk Hai with Ballista: As far as polybags go this is one of the better offerings out there, even if it is a real pain to get your hands on it.

The Uruk Hai with Ballista is great for army building, it comes with the standard looking Uruk Hai Mini-Figure, complete with double-sided print on the torso and head, with hand of Saruman markings on one side and clean the other. As well as a large Castle era axe as a weapon and the nifty new helmet piece, plus torso armor piece.
The microbuild Ballista is rather small, and used primarily to pad up the piece count
column2: I believe, the weapon itself is nice as a set piece, and multiples will really add to your Battle of Helms Deep, complete with flick-fire missiles for added playability. If you can manage to get more than one you'll get your money's worth, in-spite of the small piece count. Still haven't seen any around at TRU Canada, fortunately it was given away free with purchase of 30$ worth of LEGO LotR at the beginning of the month so I did manage to get the one. Hopefully I'll be able to army build it to the maximum of five for a good solid number of Uruk to add to Helm's Deep.

column1:
Overall I'd have to say that LEGO made some great choices with LotR and Hobbit Polybags, while the Frodo with Cooking Corner Polybag is a bit of wasted potential, this Uruk is great for army building and well worth tracking down. Strongly reccomended.
